entry.title: Re: How to manage variables in Task from a WorkFlow?
entry.content:
Hi, 

You need to copy that task into custom task and add required fields in it. You also need to copy standard workflow and in the custom workflow, you need to replace the above task with your created one. You also need to point out to custom workflow in configuration.

Dont ever change the standard task, As it will also change in other workflows.

entry.title: How to get threshold value details per metric then send to Outbound Integration?
entry.content:
Dear support, we are searching for information if there is method to easily get threshold values per metric that raised an alert into outbound integration with badi enh ( eg. IF_ACC_MEA -> methods GET_....)


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to get threshold value details per metric then se...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Thank you for reaching out.

Upon further review, I would like to clarify that the interface `IF_ACC_MEA` does not provide a standard method to retrieve metric threshold details associated with the alerts. You can refer to page 14 of the guide linked below, which outlines all the supported out-of-the-box Get methods:  

https://support.sap.com/content/dam/support/en_us/library/ssp/alm/sap-solution-manager/focused-solutions/FocusedRun-Alert-Consumer-BAdI-Interface.pdf  

To access the threshold data, you will need to implement custom code. The following resources can assist you in identifying where these threshold details are stored:  

  1. For a specific Managed Object and metric, obtain the MO ID and Metric ID by referring to KBA 2515250, which is also applicable to FRUN.  
  2. Using the MO ID and Metric ID, retrieve the threshold type (`RULE_TYPE`) from the table `ACRULETYPESDIR`.  
  3. With the threshold type, run transaction SE80->package: AI_SOLMAN_ALRT_CFG_RULETYPES->Dictionary objects->database tables:
       - `ACALREADYRATED` ‚Äì "Already Rated" rule configuration  
       - `ACBESTOFLASTN` ‚Äì "Best of last n" rule configuration  
       - `ACCOUNTERTHRESH` ‚Äì Counter threshold  
       - `ACDELTATHRESH` ‚Äì Delta threshold  
       - `ACPCTHRESDIR` ‚Äì Alert configuration: database table for percentage threshold  
       - `ACRANGETHRESHDIR` ‚Äì Database table for range threshold configuration data  
       - `ACSIMPLETHRESDIR` ‚Äì Alert configuration: database table for simple thresholds  
       - `ACTEXTTHRESHOLD` ‚Äì Rule type text threshold  
       - `ACTHRESHOLDLESS` ‚Äì Threshold less rule configuration  

These tables contain further details on the specific thresholds, including numeric values and associated texts. 

Best regards,

Ava

SAP Support

entry.title: Tracking customer-owned RMAs in ECC
entry.content:
I am a user, not an architect. We are still running an older version of ECC with a roadmap to begin kick off our S4 HANA project in 2026. 

I have an urgent need for ideas how to track Customer-owned RMAs in our current version of SAP.  

Once goods receipt is performed, we can move it in MIGO with 311E movement type. The issue we have: the material is repaired in a plant different than the GR is performed. I want to track the physical location of the RMA in SAP while moved between plants. My IT group does not have a solution to move Customer-owned material across plants. 

Anyone have ideas how to track this material across plants that will not require huge amounts of IT resources, otherwise it will get pushed to the S4 project?

Also, does S4 Hana have a solution for this? 

Thanks in advance

Cost Center Splitting Weights Integrated Financial Planning
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone please guide me on how we obtain the % splitting weight in the Operating Expense Cost Center Splitting Weights ‚Üí Operating Expense Planning ‚Üí Administration tab?

I‚Äôm unable to understand how the percentages (e.g., 80% and 20%) are derived against the cost center activity type. From what I see, the calculation uses a restricted measure labeled Subtotal Driver 2, which is then referenced in the % Splitting Weight calculated measure.

However, when I add this restricted measure (Subtotal Driver 2) to a story table and simply edit the story measure (even without changing any parameters, keeping it exactly as is), the value changes.

Why does this happen, and how can we ensure the value remains constant (e.g., 50%)?

When I edit the measure without making any changes ‚Äî keeping in mind that this is standard content ‚Äî the value still changes.

when I click on ok.. values get changed 

please guide

entry.title: Testing in an SAP system under cloud environments:
entry.content:
1. Unit Testing
Also called: Component Testing / Program-Level Validation
Conducted by ABAP developers, functional consultants, or key technical experts to verify the correctness of individual programs, Fiori apps, custom objects, or reports in isolation.
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public & Private), this includes OData services, CDS views, and custom extensions built in SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

2. Integration Testing
Also called: End-to-End Process Validation / Cross-Module Testing
Confirms that interlinked processes across modules (e.g., FI ‚Üî MM ‚Üî SD ‚Üî PP) function seamlessly without data or process breaks.
In cloud environments, also covers integration with external systems (Ariba, SuccessFactors, Concur, 3rd-party APIs) using SAP Cloud Integration Suite.

3. Regression Testing
Also called: Change Impact Testing / Functional Stability Check
Ensures that existing functionality remains unaffected after configuration changes, upgrades, hotfixes, or quarterly SAP S/4HANA Cloud releases.
Often automated in cloud environments using SAP Cloud ALM, CBTA, or Tricentis Test Automation.

4. User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
Also called: Business Validation Testing / Operational Sign-Off
Conducted by business process owners and key users to verify that real-life business scenarios (not just test cases) run as expected.
In cloud projects, UAT often aligns with Fit-to-Standard workshops to confirm process readiness before go-live.

5. Performance Testing
Also called: Load & Stress Testing / Scalability Testing
Evaluates system responsiveness, stability, and throughput under peak load conditions.
In cloud, this may involve testing Fiori app response times, background job execution, API throughput, and SAP BTP extension performance.

6. Security Testing
Also called: Authorization Validation / Access Control Testing
Verifies roles, authorizations, segregation of duties (SoD), and access restrictions according to business compliance policies.
In S/4HANA Cloud, this includes Business Role Templates, Identity Authentication Service (IAS), and Identity Provisioning Service (IPS) configurations.

7. Build Verification Testing
Also called: Sanity Check
A quick, high-level validation to confirm that critical system functions are working after a new transport, upgrade, or cloud release before deeper testing.
In public cloud, this is crucial post-release due to SAP‚Äôs quarterly upgrade cycles.

8. Data Migration Testing
Also called: Data Conversion Validation / Legacy-to-Cloud Data Verification
Ensures complete, accurate, and loss-free data transfer from legacy systems to SAP S/4HANA via tools like SAP Migration Cockpit or Data Services.
Covers data cleansing, mapping validation, reconciliation reports, and post-load functional validation to ensure business processes work with migrated data.

entry.title: Re: Declaration 390 - EC Sales List Romania
entry.content:
Hello @JAS3311 

Thank you for your inquiry about setting up and managing Declaration 390 (EC Sales List) for Romania in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Core Configuration and Process.

  • The main setup for Declaration 390 is carried out using the Configuration for Romania Declaration 390 activity in Central Business Configuration (CBC).
  • Tax codes and EU codes mapping required for the report are managed within Manage Tax Items for Legal Reporting. You can view and adjust how tax codes relate to Declaration 390‚Äôs box/group structure there. This ensures that your transactions are correctly classified under the distinct EU codes (L, T, A, P, S) as per legal requirements.
  • To process the declaration, utilise the Run Statutory Reports app. Select the RO_DCL_RECAP_390 report, filter by the period and other criteria, and review the generated results. The Manage Tax Items step ensures accurate mapping and content of each report field.
  • With the recent VAT changes in Romania (August 2025), ensure that your tax codes are current in your system's tax setup. This will guarantee that your report displays the correct totals and classifications.

Notes:

  • The total fields' content in the VIES 390 declaration is based on the tax code/EU code mapping and underlying transactional data. Manual adjustments to these totals within the declaration application are not supported; updates must be made at the transaction or configuration level..
  • For detailed instructions and compliance, please refer to the official SAP documentation:
    • Romania Declaration 390 ‚Äì SAP Help Portal
    • Configuration for Romania Declaration 390

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: The way to be a few years ago today and and I am a few years
Re: Proportional Integration - Proportion Shares - Group...
entry.content:
Hi @Fch3_ 

Thank you for your question.

For consolidation units using the proportional consolidation method in SAP Group Reporting, you need to ensure the correct handling of ownership percentages for both Group Shares and Proportion Shares so that subsequent consolidation tasks such as consolidation of investments and proportional integration of FS items work accurately.

Below are some SAP Standard Guidance and Community Consensus for your consumption:

  • You should enter the percentage of ownership, in both Task 2140 Enter Group Shares PL30 which covers the group‚Äôs shares for consolidation of investments and in Task 2145 you should Enter Proportion Shares % PL30 if your process or configuration leverages a custom task for proportional shares.
  • Please note, entering it in only one may cause subsequent tasks for example CoI task, proportional integration, not to process shares or investments correctly.
  • According to SAP documentation and user experience, entering the percentages in both places ensures that consolidation methods, eliminations and FS item postings are handled accurately for proportionately consolidated units and for correct calculation of ownership for downstream tasks.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Outbound Delivery is not updating in EWM system it is...
entry.content:
Hello @Mahavir 

Thank you for highlighting the issue with Outbound Delivery (OBD) being stuck in the queue for the Stock Transport Order (STO) process between your EWM-managed (M300) and IM-managed (W304) plants in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Outbound Delivery is stuck in the queue for an STO from the EWM-managed M300 plant to the IM-managed W304 plant. The error states:
‚ÄúNo business partner found for ERP partner 0000000000 (role: SP) (Message no. /SCWM/ERPINTEGRATION053)‚Äù

Precise Diagnosis and Cloud-Related Actions

Business Partner Mapping in Public Cloud WM:

    • In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, every customer and vendor involved in warehouse processes must have a corresponding Business Partner (BP) record with the correct roles, particularly Ship-To Party.
    • The integration expects either automatic or manual creation of BPs using Fiori apps like Manage Business Partner, ensuring that the ERP partner numbers match a BP with role SP in your warehouse organisational structure.

Master Data Synchronisation:

    • Verify that the partner number example 0000000000 in your error exists as a Business Partner with the Ship-To role in your Public Cloud tenant.
    • Use the Manage Business Partner Fiori app to verify and create or edit BPs as required.

Queue Reprocessing:

    • After fixing the missing BP, use the queue monitor app in Fiori to reprocess the stuck Outbound Delivery queue.
    • This is a standard procedure for resolving master data integration issues in Public Cloud, similar to private or on-premise solutions‚Äîwith comparable process logic but using public cloud tools and apps.

References and Judgement:

    • Please check out the SAP Help Portal documentation for Warehouse Management in S/4HANA Cloud, public, it‚Äôs a great resource to help you get started edition
      Warehouse Management ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • SAP Community also confirms BP mapping requirements and error resolution
      SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series ‚Äì Cloud
    • SAP Learning offers a complete journey for warehouse management configuration and troubleshooting in the cloud:
      SAP Learning ‚Äì Implement SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for Warehouse Management

Summary:

  • The error points to missing BP master data for your STO delivery partner.
  • Maintain BPs using Fiori apps, ensure roles and partner numbers are correctly mapped.
  • Reprocess the queue after correction.
  • These steps and requirements are standard for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Warehouse Management, based on embedded EWM principles.

Please inform me if you require any additional information.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Reference User Type Mapping To New User - GRC
entry.content:
Hi @Prashanth85 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP, a type L reference user is typically used to assign additional authorizations to other users by mapping roles or profiles. By associating the reference user to a type A dialog user, you allow the latter to inherit the authorizations assigned to the reference user, facilitating authorization management and compliance.

Below are the technical Feasibility:

  • SAP GRC ARM workflow can be configured to provision a new SAP user and, as part of the workflow, map the required reference user during the provisioning process.
  • During user creation or change in GRC ARM, you can set the reference user in the user master record SU01 via workflow, either through custom fields or by automating the assignment in BRF+ rules or MSMP workflow actions.
  • SAP supports this configuration and there are documented experiences in the community confirming successful setups for mapping type L reference users to type A users in user provisioning flows.

Here are insightful key points:

  • This mapping ensures that compliance, SOD and risk analysis leverage the reference user permissions as part of the access provisioning.
  • The process can be customized to your organization‚Äôs governance needs within the multi-stage or multi-path workflow and Business Rule Framework.
  • Make sure that GRC auto-provisioning and connector configurations allow reference user assignments during the request creation or approval stage.

For detailed setup, refer to your workflow configuration in MSMP and BRF+ for the user provisioning path.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Thanks,

Nuno Pereira

entry.title: Re: SAP certificate not received after passing the certif...
entry.content:
Hi @Koustav_Sarkar 

If you have passed your SAP certification exam for SAP Certified Associate SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Management Accounting on August 10, 2025, but have not received your digital badge or certificate, here is what you should do:

The common Reasons for Delay

  • Digital badges and certificates are typically issued within 24 to 48 hours after exam completion, provided your SAP Universal ID setup is correct with a linked recovery email.
  • Sometimes, it can take a few business days up to a week in rare cases.
  • If you already raised a support ticket and haven't received a response, it is possible there is a backlog or technical issue.

What You Should Check and Do

  1. Confirm your SAP Universal ID
    • Make sure you have a valid SAP Universal ID set up and that your recovery or personal email is linked.
    • Do not register a new Universal ID if you already have one instead, link any new email to your existing account.
  2. Check you Junk or Spam Folders
    • Look for emails from SAP Learning Hub or Credly which is the platform SAP uses for badges in all your inbox folders.
  3. SAP Learning Portal
    • Go to your Certifications page on the SAP Learning portal. Sometimes you can access your certification record directly there, even if the badge email is delayed.
  4. Raise an Incident in the Correct Category
    • If you need status or technical help regarding the badge or certificate, create a ticket in the User Support Center under the Digital Badge service category and the Certification incident category.
    • Mention your certification ID, exam date, and existing ticket number for reference.
  5. Contacts and Escalation
    • For urgent cases especially when previous tickets go unanswered, try reaching out via SAP‚Äôs official certification support or use social channels such as the SAP Learning Community.
    • Sometimes, posting on the SAP Learning Q&A forum can speed up responses as moderators escalate unresolved cases.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. 

Best regards

Chris
